Description: Ostracon, large section of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is brown in section, the interior is dusted with a light-grey granular deposit, the exterior is covered with a grey-brown slip, which has worn away in many places, and very faint traces of four lines of red-painted (?) Coptic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394680) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394680)
